text: Bottle. Pours opaque black, medium creamy tan head, dissipates slowly, pretty solid lacing. Aroma is smoky, hardwood char, roast, ashy, molasses. Flavor is light sweet and medium bitter, surprisingly low in acidity. Light smokiness present but not dominant. Underlying porter comes through roasty, molasses and ashy notes. Full body, lingering bitter finish. Smokiness fades as you drink more. Perhaps could use a bit more smoke, but otherwise quite good.

(Back log) Bottle sampled with Palindrome at studio 1. Whew, this had a little something , something. Full body and nice notes roasted malts, nuts, Earth, wood and smoke. I think this is one of my favorite porters.

750 mL bottle, not sure if there was a 2014 and 2015 batch. I dont think so, rather this is just a 2014 bottle with some age on it. Shared by tectactoe on 7/24/15 (finished it the next day, as well).Strong tan head emerges atop a dark, ebony body that shows good clarity and deep magenta highlights on the edges. Good retention.Smoky in the nose, yes, but not Bamberg smoky. Lots more roastiness, char and even some moderate chocolate-like sweetness. Vanilla-tipped cigars, moderate fruity notes (dark cherries, concord grapes) and no alcohol or flaws noted. Not an overly intense aroma, but whats there is very well-balanced and nicely complex. Not every smoked beer can or need be a Bamberg/Schlenkerla-style beer.The flavor divulges even more than the aroma. Medium-sweet pale malts combine with the roasted malt notes and smoked malts to give a pretty classic oily/vinous, aged cigar-like character up front. But the malts keep it balanced, adding light sweetness and soft, supple body. Carbonation is medium-low but tight and engaging enough. Vanilla and cocoa notes continue through the middle, actually tipping the balance of the beer away from the smokiness. The finish ends on a more dry, ashen-like flavor. Nowhere the rich, bacon and salt one might expect from the commercial description, but rather a dry, charred, cigar-like character thats every bit as intriguing/enjoyable. Really nice stuff and well-balanced, which can be tough to achieve with this style. That it held up perfectly to be finished the next day also speaks to its quality. Thanks, Tony!

black, no head. Good chocolate roast aroma. Aroma is chocolate, fudge and beer. Smokey with chocolate and a little fudge and old coffee. Good malt presence. Good color, good taste. Smoke isnt too intense.

750 ml bottle. Pitch black thin head. Aroma is dark roasted grain, chocolate with a light underlying smoke. Flavor is nice, smoke is here without question but doesnt overpower the Porter. Deep roasted grain, smoke that lingers after the sip. Body is nice for a Porter.
When I first started to drink this beer it was way too smoky but then when I waited the smokiness mellowed out and tastes pretty good.

Founders smoked Porter taste 8 aroma 8 look 4 mouth 4 overall 15. Poured a dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of.Smokey meat, light coder and roasted malts. Flavor was certainly smoke forward, but not astringent or.burnt, and nice underlying beer as well. Good.

Bottle thanks to charule. Pours a medium to dark brown. Light brown head. Aromas of smoke, cocoa powder, grain. Taste is sweet with a slightly dry finish. Body is medium thin and medium high carbonation. Pretty balanced smoked Porter.

February 23, 2015 - bottle via trade with Corey, who hooked me up very generously. Dark brown pour with nice amount of head that lasted a little bit. Aroma was smoke, wood and malt. Taste was consistent with the aroma and nicely balanced. The finish was a tad dry, but not so much that I negatively impacted the palate score because of it, and a touch of alcohol. Surprisingly full bodied for a porter and fairly smooth drinking.  Not super exciting, but very well done.
This was a great one. Full review here... http://moviescigarsandabrew.com/?p=317
это пиво очень вкусно. я бы, конечно, рекомен& его всем. пожалуй& обратит& его. очень хорошо!

Bottle at James for the multi-K tasting. Pours a soft brown with a thin tan head. Soft smoke and a bit of cocoa, chocolate. Medium bodied, smoke and cocoa, soft chocolate. Faint cocoa into the finish. Decent enough, soft lingering smoke.
Great porter, good smoke not overdone. Ageing may have taken edge off. Very drinkable. Above average mouthfeel.
Tap at Ashleys. Color is jet black with tan head. Smoked meat and sugar aroma. Taste is a yummy chocolate bar with Smokey syrup.
Bottle shared by Ryan - thanks!! Dark brown pour. Big smoked nose, bacon. Taste is nice. Very smokey, roasted malt, chocolate.
Drought at RattlenHum. Dark brown with very small off-white head, chocolate aroma, low carbonation, cocoa taste withs trong alcohol undertones, medium finish. Very very good.
Draft into a snifter - nose is smoke - quite campfire-ish. This is what I expected. Smooth. A treat. Only complaint is that it is a tad light on the body.

Shifter at Triangle Wine Morrisville..good aroma sweet smokey. Nice level of smoke with a sweet chocolate malty aroma. Brownish black color good head and lace. Sweet flavor. Medium body thick smooth creamy mouthfeel. Sweet smoke finish nice. Especially after a hot day at work.
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Very mild smoke in this beer. Nice chocolate notes. Not the big smoke that I want in a smoked beer but a good showing.

Poured from 6 month old deuce. Deep black pour with brown hue, 1-2 inches cocoa colored head. Smoked malt scent, mesquite, oats, sweet chocolate, malt balls, hay. Soft carbonation, oily light mouthfeel, acidic but clean finish. Flavors of smoked wood, light hickory or mesquite, chocolate, spicy at the finish. Great rich porter with nice subtle smoked element.
Poured a schillers house. Thanks. Dark brown color, brown head. Nice restraint on the smoke. The base porter shines with the smoke as an added component and not dominating. Tasty.
Very similar to the regular porter but with a slight smoke character. Nice big roasty porter with a great mouthfeel.
a pretty solid smoky beer, albeit it wasnt too much. a decent representation of the style.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours black with a tan head. Taste smokey, roasted malt, dark chocolate. I thought this was good. I could drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the MBG Summerfest. Im a fan of smoked beers and this one had that quality nicely. A dark pour and a slightly thicker feel. A good smoked porter but I would definitely prefer Founders regular porter.
Pours black. Aroma and taste are smokey and roasted malts. Very smooth with a long smokey aftertaste.
Rate 1000. Bottle from near Milford MI. Poured black with good tan lace. Aroma of choc decent smoke campfire brown sugar. Light light carb med bod. Roasty malt sweet lingering choc.
Bottle. Pours near black with a beige head. Roasted and medium smoked malts, moderate sweetness, light bitterness, and a nice balanced and rich smoked malty finish. Pretty dope.
Bottle pours a dark brown/black with a large tan head. Smokey burnt wood campfire aroma. Taste has a solid but not overpowering smokey wood , with bitter chocolate and mild molasses. Nice!

Bottle: &nbsp Deep brown, cola highlights, moderate frothy beige head, spotty lacing. &nbsp Smoked malt aroma, a little meaty, slight Band-Aid. &nbsp Thankfully no real Band-Aid on the nose. &nbsp Some smokiness, very little roasted malts, a lighter example. &nbsp Was hoping this was in the caliber of Alaskan, but its too light. &nbsp Body and mouthfeel are minor. &nbsp Soft roasty finish, a little smokey. &nbsp Not big enough for me. &nbsp Thanks Kevin!

Black pour thick tan head .... Aroma is of smoked malts and caramel/roasted malts .... Taste is of oak, heavily roasted and smoked malts, chocolate and caramel malts and a bitter bite on the back end .... Mouthfeel is thick and oily with a slickness .... Has a pretty full body and stout feel to it. Abv hidden well ... These guys always nail dark brews.
Tap from Growler Spot. Pours a cola brown with a thin layer of toffee colored head. Aroma of bacon and malts. Taste of smoked meats, roasted malts, and some coffee.

On draft at the brewpub. Pours a rich dark brown with a thick tan head. Aroma of smoke, peat, earth and campfire notes. Mild roast and chocolate notes. Flavor is smokey, with lots of umami and bitter roast notes. Some malt sweetness. Medium bodied, somewhat slick oily mouthfeel. Finishes smokey. A well-done beer.
Pours cola brown with a thick tan head. Aroma of roast, chocolate, and ashy smoke. The taste follows. Solid smoked porter.

Draft at Binnys South Loop into thin New Holland tulip. Aroma is prominently smoked with a strong lean roasted malt character. This is how I imagine a standard smoked porter should be but I love smoke. Flavor is similarly lean and centered on smoke and slightly bitter black malt with a long smoke and roast finish. Lean and well attenuated, just the way this should be. Why its an uber special 750 release and not a regular 6 pack boggles my mind.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Poured from 750mL bottle. Dark black with tan head. Smoke and some coffee with some chocolate notes. Taste focuses on the coffee and sweet chocolate flavour with mild smoke. Hides the alcohol. Light-medium body.

Dark brown. Small head. Smokey Hammy, campfire, sausagey. Backed up with sufficient maltiness. Some good chocolate. Lighter body. Hood smokiness. I liked the balance to it all as a whole. Not as good or complex or refined as the mainstays, but its Founders so its given a bump. Mouthfeel falls short. Thin and not as flavorful as I would expect.

Keg @ Beer Run. Deep brown with a medium tan head. Rich smokey malt nose. Robust chocolate, earth, oatmeal cookies. The taste is similar. Mellow smokiness complements chocolate and caramel flavors. A bit of heat, slight husky grain. Full body, oily. Nice.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2015 Fills sinuses with smoky flavor. Pours deep brown with small tan head. Smooth and mildly sweet with woody finish. Pretty decent. Compliments bbq and wood fired pizza and Chinese well
Draft at Beer Run. Pours a clear dark orange-brown with a thin tan collar. Aroma of strong smoke, dark malts, nuts. The taste is roasted malts, chocolate, smoke. Medium bodied.

On tap at Tremont Tap house. Black with ring head and not much lace. Smoky chocolately woody ashy aroma with a little boozy fruit. Medium smoky ashy roasted chocolate sweetness with boozy raisiny fruitiness and woody ashy roasted dark chocolate and very spicy cinnamon woody finish. Medium to full body. A little boozier than abv. Very good, but not nearly as good as Stone or Alaskan IMHO.

Delightful on draft...slightly sweet smokiness...long molasses like finish...smoke is subtle and soft very unlike Schlenklera

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark brown, almost black. The head retention is a sticky tan color that hugs my glass. The aroma is of a blend of malts, not too smokey and not too sweet. There was a nice coffee and chocolate notes too. The flavor mimicked the aroma, a very balanced beverage. The finish was pleasant with a mild lingering bitterness. Overall this drink was a wonderfully tame smoked porter.
On tap at the Blue Dog in Chalfont. Poured a dark brown, almost black with a smaller sized off white head. Smoke, roasty, caramel, and some chocolate. Some lighter meatiness.

On tap at the Beer House in Yorktown Center, Lombard, IL. during a Founders tap takeover. Dispensed to a large snifter, showing an opaque, black/brown hue, with a frothy layer of tan, head foam, and clingy streaks & spots of lacing. The aroma was a mellow nose of wood & smoke, then roasted mocha notes, and smooth malt. Medium+ bodied, with some liveliness to the carbonation, the taste added a touch of caramel sweetness, and presented a medium, lingering bitterness that was earthy, with a touch of charred astringency, maybe a little slickness on the tongue at first, but gradually smoothed by a bit of creaminess to the mouthfeel, so no bite. Appreciated the flavorful balance without being overly "rauched"

Founders Smoked

A $10 bottle picked up by my sister from the brewery. People say this is a bomber (22oz), but its 760ml (25oz). 

Appearance: Pours a deep black color with a very small brown head on top. I generally notice porters to be ruby black, but oh well. Minimal lacing. Looks fair. (3.5/5)

Smell: Definitely smoked, without question. Almost a smoked meat sort of aroma coming off. Woody notes. Some chocolate, and a bit more coffee. As said, obviously smokey, but not overwhelmingly so. Quite nice. (4/5)

Taste/feel: Smokey, ashy, woody, roasty -- very nice taste. That smoked meat quality is also in the flavor, but its more on the nose. Theres also a slight sort of tanginess almost that suggests a meatiness further. The feel is on-point for a porter, in my opinion. This brew has a medium/high sort of carbonation, with about a medium body. Easy drinking, and not heavy. 8% is unnoticeable. Not a mindblowingly unique beer with a huge depth of flavor, but its still a joy to drink if you like some smokey beers. (4.25/5, 4.75/5)

$10 for this 750ml bottle isnt a bad price at all, but Id not pay much more for it. Its a fabulous example of a smoked porter though, and one worth trying if you can get it at a reasonable price.

4.25/5

Bottle shared at the 11k/7k/5k. Man these guys make the best dark beers. Aroma is ashes from a nice campfire, bacon, chocolate, and coffee. Pours black with a medium brown head. Taste is roasty, fiery, chocolatey, and a nice delicious malt finish.

Had a glass on tap as part of a flight in Bigalora A2. I was expecting a little more out of this one, being a favorite brewery with a favorite style. Its pretty mild.Very good, Id just like a bit more smoke.

On tap at World of Beer on 4/8/14. Pitch black pour with a thick tan head. Aroma of bacon, malt, roast and slight chocolate. Chocolate and roast flavor with slight smoke before a roast and bitter dark chocolate finish.
On tap at the Happy Gnome. Strong roasted malt with bitterness to complement the smokiness.
Smoked dark chocolate, roasted coffee, wood, toast and just enough smoke. Hints of smoked meat, as strange as it sounds. Well balanced flavors. Perfect carbonation and texture.

The Smoked Porter pours a very dark brown to black color with a thick tan brown head that lasts decently. The aroma is milk, coffee and smoked wood. The milk hits the palate first with coffee and then there is a smokey aftertaste and the hint of wood mixed in. Overall this is a nice beer. If only it were easier to access.
Draft. Dark pour. Sufficiently smoked nose. Flavor is smoky but sweet. Some fruit flavors. Definitely reminiscent of the original but not as good.

750 ml bottle into snifter, bottled in 1/2014. Pours pitch black color with a 1-2 finger dense tan head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a light streaming carbonation. Aromas of dark chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, toast, dark bread, wood smoke, light coffee, light char, herbal, light pepper, and roast/smoke earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of dark/roasted/smoked malt and light earthy hop notes; with good strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, dark bread, toast, wood smoke, light coffee, light char, herbal, light pepper, and roast/smoke earthiness. Light spicy hop and roast bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, roast, toast, dark bread, wood smoke, light coffee, herbal, light pepper, and roast/smoke earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice complexity balance, robustness, and complexity of dark/roasted/smoked malt and moderate earthy hop flavors; with zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a smooth, creamy, and fairly bready mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent smoked porter style. All around great balance, complexity, and robustness of dark/roasted/smoked malt and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the ABV. A very enjoyable offering.
Bottle at 7K/5K. Pours black with brown head. Nose/taste of smoked meats, roast chocolate, smoked wheat, beechwood and smoked cherrywood. Medium body.
growler form ABW, medium bodied black pour. big roastiness, nice solid but not over done smokiness. very nice

On tap at Partisan DC. Pours a mostly translucent, deep mahogany with some wispy, off white head. Nose is well balanced, clearly some smoke, but plenty of roasted mushroom too, some toast, some malt, a little licorice, a bit of soy. Flavor is also well balanced, heavy umami, mushroom, burnt meat, some molasses, burnt caramel, toast, wisps of smoke. The smokiness in this beer is more barbeque smoke than tire fire. Full bodied, dry, smokey finish.
Bottle at clocks. Pours a deep murky brown. Aroma is roast and. Earth. Mouthfeel is medium to full with notes of earthy roast, espresso, and chocolate.
Bottle. Black pour with tan head. Smoked, bacon, peat aromas. Flavor is chocolate, roasted malt, peat, smoke flavors.

Draft at EBF. Exceedingly drinkable toasty and smokey porter. Some chocolate, meat, and smoke are dominant. Love this great job founders on finally getting back on track with the backstage debacles of the past.
Draft to glass. Black brown pour with a thin light brown head. Nose is bittersweet chocolate with roasted nuttiness and campfire. Taste is smooth bodied coffee, light dark chocolate, and campfire.

Draft at Slows Bar-B-Q. Black pour with a small foamy head that lingers a bit. Aromas are smoked meat, burnt wood, campfire, and a light sweetness. Tastes exactly how I like my smoked beers. Nice balance of the smoked meat and bacon taste with the campfire and ash taste. A nice light creamy sweetness brings it together well. Medium body, smooth mouthfeel. Very balanced smoked beer and very easy to drink. 4-packs next year please?
sample at EBF, this one was great! Big smoked flavors with big ash and roast, The beechwood adds a bacony light smokeyness. Very nice, and its highly drinkable.
75cl, new exclusive American brew Anno 2014, thx alot to Dirk for sharing!, complex smoked Porter, roasted/malty and slightly smoked/woody, yet not too heavy, balanced, hazy, rocky head, good brew

Bottle. Pours black with tan head. Aroma is smoke, charcoal, a bit of chocolate, oak. Flavor is distinct smoke flavor with deep chocolate/malt body. Some good roasted malt tones. Heavy at 8% but alcohol is masked well. Long finish with good charred wood tones.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2014 Pours a dark brown with a foamy off-white head. Has an aroma of smoke, wood, and beef jerky. Flavor is an amazing blend of smoked malts and a slight touch of bitterness. Has a full body feel and goes down smooth. An incredible and delicious porter from Founders.

Bottle from trade. Pours pitch black with a tall brown and creamy head on top. Lots of char and smoke as expected, lots of wood, roast, more smoke. Flavor is mostly smoke and wood, tastes like a campfire, a bit of roasted grains, and more charred wood. Just a bit of sweet dark fruits behind it. No question what they were going for here. Mouthfeel is thinner than the look, and seems right about on for a porter. Good beer, hit what they were going for, but not quite up to the experimental mode they've done with this series. Very solid beer either way.

Thanks steimie! 750 ml bottle into a tulip glass. Pours a pitch black with a tan/dark khaki foam. Nice lacing. Nose is smoked meats and malts intertwined with chocolate and coffee beans. Taste is similar. Smoked malts bordering on savory and meaty before being balanced by some chocolate and coffee malt. Not as over the top as some rauchbiers. Its actually a really nice balance of flavors here. Falls short of Alaskans porter but this was damn impressive for a style I usually find to be hit or miss.
Sampled @ Hunahpu Day 2014. Pours black with tan head. Aromas of roasted and smoked malts with some chocolate and pine hops. Similar flavors. Medium to full body with moderate carbonation. Very nice.

4 ounce draft at ChurchKey poured into a tasting snifter. Pours black with a finger of tan head. Aromas of well balanced smoke, roast, coffee, dark chocolate. Tasting notes of well balanced smoke, roast, caramel, dark chocolate, dark fruit. Full body with a dry finish. Low carbonation, thick creamy mouthfeel. Smoke is well done, not under or over balanced.

750mL Bottle. Thanks Sean! Crackling rich porter nose, chocolate, char and caramel. Inviting. Flavors are standup, this starts as a really stiff and robust porter with great malt breadth, kissed with ideas of smoke. The smoke to me feels like the notion of barrel char amplified one hundred fold. The smoke character is indistinguishable to type and personally Id take a lot more smoke, but as this is, its a really nice version of a classic smoked porter, subdued in the smokiness but forward in the porter quality, with the smoke qualities helping along the harder edges of the porter. Great porter.
Great porter. Pours black with decent head and lacing. Robust smokey malt aroma with some chocolate. Beechwood definitely does a good service here. Bitter finish. Medium thickness. Tap at Churchkey.

Bottle from Sean - thanks! Black pour with a nice froth of tan foam that craters out a bit as it settles. Aroma is clean, dry smoke with some bacon over dry roast and chocolate. Barely any sweetness perceptible in the aroma. Taste is dry smoke with wheat, underlying chocolate, and some darker malt sweetness toward the finish. Clean, relatively dry mouthfeel. Tightly engineered beer - excellent smoked beer.
Very prominent smoke flavor. Almost reminds me of sausage. Otherwise, similar to their oatmeal stout.
bottle. thick near black with one finger head. dark chocolate malt with smokey woodiness. seems almost meaty. smooth and complex.

Tap at The Fickle Peach: Served in standard pint glass which actually was disappointing. Pours near opaque with a small but lasting frothy tan head, okay lace. This beer is all about the smoked malts, firm and ever present supported by caramel, roast, hint of chocolate and light resiny hops. Faint fruity esters as well. The mouth feel is medium-bodied with the expected ashy finish. I nicely done beer, exceeded my expectations. Need to get a bottle.

Bomber to pint, thick black in appearance with tall head. The nose has hints of smokiness. Taste of roasted coffee, dark chocolate, and smoke, a little bitterness in the finish. The smokey presence seems to be just about right, not overdone. A decent brew overall.

Draft. Pours black. Excellent balance. Subtle smoke and chocolate in the aroma and taste. Neither one overpowers the other but, both consistently show up. The mouthfeel is rich and creamy for the style like the original porter. Really good backstage installment. I wish they sent bottles out for distribution. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. Black with a tan head. Aroma is subtle smoke and cocoa. Taste follows suit and adds some lactic notes. Smooth rich palate. Excellent balance. Really good.
Nice lacing, aroma, mouthfeel, and taste. Easy to drink and rewarding as u work your way through the pour.

On tap at Hunahpus Day 2014. Deep brown color with light tan head. Aroma is lightly smokey, dark grainy malt, some molasses-like sweetness. Taste is pleasantly smoked, not like a lot of American smoked beers. I also enjoy the roasted malt sweetness. Thick and somewhat creamy mouthfeel.

Draft @ The Family Dog. Dark brown/black with ample laying dark tan head. Smell is roast, old coffee, toffee. Taste is bold roasted malts,medium to light smoke, nutty, bits of burnt malt, semi sweet chocolate. Good smoked brew, but smoked is sinking into the bottom of my hierarchy of styles. Founders fanboy fo life tho!

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2014 Rerate. Originally 8 5 8 5 18. Only change is aroma, for carrying a beautiful smoked pork (bacon?) scent which is beautiful. 

Original. On tap at Dan's. The pour is a nice black with a decently thick darker khaki head. The aroma is chocolatey, a little coffee to it and then a gorgeous smokey character. It's like a smoked Founders Porter, but the chocolate and coffee notes are light. The flavor is a bit more smokey, and blends perfectly with the coffee and chocolate. The mouth feel is just about perfect. There is a great thickness that coats, followed up by a wonderfully dry aftertaste. This is a solid smoked beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap. Black pour thick mocha head. Aroma is smoke but not obnoxiously smokey. Taste is a nice mix of smoke, roasty malts chocolate and some sweetness. Wasnt expecting much. But exceeded my expectations.

My Bottom Line:
This roasty Smoked Porter benefits from just fruitiness and slowly rising wooden smoke fumes as leafy bitterness balances everything out.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A ring of foam circles the darkness.
-Mouthfeel is quite rich.
-Alcohol is not a bother at all; residual sugars and malt complexities make sure you focus on them instead of the brews potential heat.
-This is on the verge of being in Imperial Stout territory.

On tap at The Worthy Burger.

Draft in a taster at Ei8ht Ball. Pours a deep, mostly opaque brown with a small tan head. Smoked and roasted malts, dark chocolate, toasted sugars, earth, coffee, and some underlying sweet malts. Light-medium bodied, with moderate carbonation and a smooth, lightly smoky mouthfeel. A little thin, but really nice overall.

Sampled from the bottle, 
this beer poured a dark brown and provided a two to three finger creamy, tan and brown colored bubbled head that receded after a few minutes but there was a layer on top of the glass, it left some fingers and spots of foamy lacing, the bottom of the bottle had a thin layer/film of a ring of sediment that moved around when the bottle was tipped, the sediment was pretty loose, towards the last pour of the bottle all of the sediment had disappeared, 

the aromas were roasted malt, some coffee, and a bit of chocolate in the background with faint brown sugar, 
there was wood smoke, wood fire ash, and a little oily smoke mixed in with the nose, 
it had flavors of roasted malt an smoke with some coffee and very little chocolate, 
the finish had a little bitterness (it appeared to be malt bitterness, maybe just a touch of astringency) with roasted malt and smoke trailing, 

the mouth feel was about medium, it was creamy and had average carbonation, 

this beer had a nice mix of porter beer and smoke, a good drink.

On tap at Pickwick and frolic- pours dark chocolate brown, fine thin tan head. Smokey hues, oak and more smoked malts, super strong. Chewy cinnamon sticks, coffee and roasted malts, almost burnt coffee beans actually, a little peaty, with a fair amount of acidity. Love porters and this is a potent smoked offering that might be a tad too much even for me. Still pretty good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Why would you only bottle this tasty brew for Michiganders? Not cool man. Was glad to see it available on draft at Leons. Pours a lovely dark, dark brown with ample lasting mocha head. Scent is roasty smoke and chocolate. Flavor has roasty front end bite the transitions to a sweet finish. Smoke flavor present throughout. Nice light-heavy body with proper carbonation. Draft - Leons - Decatur, GA

Draft. Poured dark brown color with an average tan frothy head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate to heavy caramel, smoke and toasted malt aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy sweet smoked flavor with a medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate to long duration. Complex solid beer.

Taster on tap at Ei8ht Ball. Nice smokiness, roast, dark chocolate in the aroma. Very dark brown, slightly red color... Not completely opaque, clear around the edges. Thin ring of khaki head. Some short ropes of lace. Medium to bigger body, kind of chewy. Lighter, kind of crisp carbonation. Lightly slick. Moderate bitter taste, light sweet. Some earthy hop in there, hoppier than your typical porter, I think. Very tasty, solid smoked porter. Not really astounding though, Im kind of used to being wowed by the Backstage series. Its a great smoked porter but lacks a wow factor. Good bitter dark chocolate and coffee notes start to come out in the finish after this has sat for a while. Raised it a point in the end. Let this one warm up and sit, it gets pretty good. Still prefer Founders Porter, though, all around its much better rounded (from what I remember).

Bottle: The aroma consists of chocolate, roast, campfire, and faint coffee. It pours a dark brown with no transparency and a one finger tan head. There is some sporadic dotted lacing left on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with moderate chocolate and light caramel. The finish has roasted coffee, campfire smoke, and a touch of burnt notes. It?s medium bodied with moderate carbonation.
Black flat pour from draft at northdown. Very smokey. Firewood and fire smoke tater. Very good.
Bomber. Dark dark brown. Almost black. Nice khaki head. Aroma is coffee, wood and smoke. The smoke adds a fun dimension to one of the best porters out there.-- rated with beerbasher

To be fair, smoked beers are tough to perfect...heres another casualty. Expected more from a Backstage release, but it was thin, unbalanced, and obnoxious. The overwhelming imitation liquid smoke flavor overpowered the subtleties of one of the best Porters on the market. Maybe a BA version could work? In the meantime, Ill be using the rest of mine for a marinade...Mole Sauce anyone?
Another wonderful porter from Founders, but a sub-par smoked. Dark black color and multi roasted and grain aromas and flavors. Smoke was barely there!

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2014 Tap @ Founders: Almost completely pitch black with a khaki head that hangs around a bit before turning into a chunky collar. Aroma has a very lovely, sweet smoke component that hits with both sides of the smoke spectrum - a lightly sweet, meat/bacon note comes in from the start, leading into a more campfire, ashy & woodsy smoke essence that lingers in the finish. Roasted malts & dark cocoa undertones lift the smokiness even higher. Taste is wonderful smoked wood chips, lightly sweet smoke, peat, cocoa dust, & perhaps the slightest hint of coffee grinds. Quite nutty in the aftertaste, too, but still retaining that lovely campfire smoky essence with a great balance of char & sweetness. I may be biased because I love smoked stuff, but this beer was great! I would love to see this stuff in six (or even four) packs... The smoke is executed quite elegantly, here. Bravo!

Shared bomber. Tall cocoa head. Opaque, dark brown. Smokey nose. Smoother palate than I would expect with a smoked beer. Drank this after a meal, but it would have been better to pair with food. . . maybe a really good burger or another beef-based dish.
On tap at taps 25. Near black with a dark, beige head. Chocolate and smoke. Perfect amount of smoke, malt and chocolate. I could get into Ames beers if they were all like this.

Aroma is smoky, chocolate, coffee, bonfire. Appearance is black, brown head. Taste is more porter than smoke, although comes about subtle at the end, the smoky flavor hangs at the end. Mouthfeel is wonderful, smooth, thick, soft carbonation. Overall, its damn tasty, but I was expecting more.
Dark grainy malt balanced nicely with a subtle smoke flavor. Its worth a taste, and Im hoping it will age well.

750ml bottle - pours an opaque brown . Mild smoke and chocolate aromas . Rich palate . Moderate smoke , some roasted coffee and milk chocolate . Very tasty . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: APR 15, 2015 On tap, at founders, huge smoke flavor... absolutely wonderful highly recommended. .. do it
Enjoyed at Mittenfest by Burnhearts. Definite smokey roasty aroma, appearence muddled due to low light, better as it warmed, but smoke more present in aroma than taste
